text:
The Trump campaign paid $3 million to proceed with a partial recount in two Wisconsin counties.

When it concluded, President-elect Joe Biden's winning margin had increased by 87 total votes.

name: NPR
text:
Do you belieeeeeve in life after eight years alone? 

Kaavan the elephant has been by himself at the Islamabad Zoo since his partner died of gangrene in 2012. He's moving to a sanctuary in Cambodia thanks to efforts by activists, including @Cher. https://t.co/7i8ZIZeUmk

name: NPR
text: Canada has blocked the distribution of certain medications outside the country in response to a U.S. plan to import drugs from Canada. President Trump promised it would lower costs and be a "game changer" for seniors. https://t.co/P9m7QSnGfB

name: NPR
text: Scores of agricultural workers were reportedly slaughtered in Nigeria's Borno state by suspected Islamist militants. https://t.co/4zJ7Mqo0Uv

name: NPR
text:
We're born with the wiring for both kindness and cruelty, so altruism is not inevitable. It's a skill and a habit that we have the power to foster.

Here are some ways parents can help their children cultivate kindness. (@nprlifekit) https://t.co/3bt5mQJ19O

text: The metallic prism has inspired theories to its origin after its discovery in a remote location in Red Rock Country. Officials say it was removed by an "unknown party." https://t.co/RPJ12BMhKb
